message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about improving the state-of-the-art in Neural Machine Translation (NMT) using Deep Neural Networks (DNNs). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also proposes a novel linear associative unit (LAU) to address the problem of gradient diffusion in deep NMT systems, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper uses empirical studies to evaluate the proposed model, which could also place it in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper mentions the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for image captioning, which could suggest a connection to cs.CV (Computer Vision).
